definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to split/to crack/to break open/to rend

sentences.english: Mitoses by themselves are not indicators of malignancy.
sentences.chinese: 核分裂的出現不能說明惡性腫瘤的存在。

sentences.english: Atypical mitotic figures were present in the epithelial and stromal cells.
sentences.chinese: 上皮細胞與間質細胞異型不明顯，未見核分裂象。

sentences.english: EGTA treatments inhibited both pollen tube growth and GN division.
sentences.chinese: EGTA處理則同時抑制花粉管生長和生殖核分裂。

sentences.english: These fission products burn hot but relatively quickly.
sentences.chinese: 這些核分裂產物燃燒時非常熱，但很快就燒完了。

sentences.english: Mitotic activity and tumor necrosis were the independent prognostic factors.
sentences.chinese: 核分裂和腫瘤性壞死是獨立的風險因素。

sentences.english: After fertilization, the primary endosperm nucleus divides earlier than zygote .
sentences.chinese: 受精後，初生胚乳核分裂先於合子。
圖示三個異常核分裂相。

sentences.english: The residual heat is caused from the radioactive decay of fission products.
sentences.chinese: 引起的殘餘熱量核分裂產物的放射性衰變。

sentences.english: Nuclear fission was one of the most dramatic discoveries of the 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 核分裂是20世紀最重大的發現之一。

sentences.english: However, aormal mitoses are highly indicative of malignancy.
sentences.chinese: 然而病理性核分裂高度提示惡性腫瘤。

sentences.english: Meiosis comprises a pair of specialized nuclear divisions that produce haploid germ cells.
sentences.chinese: 減數分裂由兩次產生單倍體生殖細胞的核分裂組成。

sentences.english: At the right, the tumor is less differentiated and several dark mitotic figures are seen.
sentences.chinese: 右邊分化較差，並且可見幾個深染的病理性核分裂象。
